results.title: Investigating Programmed Cell Death and Tumor Invasion in a Three-Dimensional (3D) Microfluidic Model of Glioblastoma
results.text_hl: The molecular and genetic heterogeneity of @<m>DISEASE_Glioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005910 @@@gliomas@@@ result in a varied and often suboptimal response to treatment that is usually predicated on standard pathologic diagnoses.

results.title: Antiglioma via regulating oxidative stress and remodeling tumor-associated macrophage using lactoferrin-mediated biomimetic codelivery of simvastatin/fenretinide.
results.text_hl: In this work, a noncytotoxic drug combination (i.e., @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Fenretinide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017313 @@@fenretinide@@@) was revealed to be potent for treating @<m>DISEASE_Glioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005910 @@@glioma@@@, which was co-encapsulated into a @CHEMICAL_tocophersolan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C014225 @@@TPGS@@@-TAT-embedded lactoferrin nanoparticle system for achieving brain-targeted biomimetic delivery via the LRP-1 receptor.

citations.NLM: Mo X, Zheng Z, He Y, Zhong H, Kang X, Shi M, Liu T, Jiao Z, Huang Y. results.title: Inhibition of AMPK-dependent autophagy enhances in vitro antiglioma effect of simvastatin.
results.text_hl: The role of autophagy, a process in which the cell self-digests its own components, was investigated in @<m>DISEASE_Glioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005910 @@@glioma@@@ cell death induced by the @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@hydroxymethylglutaryl-coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase@@@-inhibiting drug @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

results.title: HMG CoA reductase inhibitors, NSAIDs and risk of glioma.
results.text_hl: From July 2007 to January 2010, we recruited a total of 517 cases and 400 controls. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ showed significant inverse associations with @<m>DISEASE_Glioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005910 @@@glioma@@@ (odds ratio [OR] = 0.49, 95% confidence interval [CI] 0.30, 0.81 and OR = 0.47, 95% CI 0.24, 0.93, respectively).

citations.NLM: Ferris JS, McCoy L, Neugut AI, Wrensch M, Lai R. HMG CoA reductase inhibitors, NSAIDs and risk of glioma. Int J Cancer. 2012 Sep 15;131(6):E1031-7. PMID: 22419506
